name: Hagiographa: The Emperor Saints
text:
Hagiographa
The Emperor Saints


Saint Ami-El
Mysterious, anonymous, and first of the Emperor-Saints, Ami-El is patron of the deification of Emperors, and thus presides over all forms of Emperor-worship. He (or she) is the protector spirit of the Temple of the One, which is said to have been founded on the grave of Alessia, and guards the Dragonfire geas and rituals later instated by Reman Cyrodiil.

Saint Belharza
Firstborn of All-Saint Alessia and her consort, the god Morihaus, Belharza the Man-Bull served as the second Emperor, and permanently established the frontiers of Cyrodiil. As a living icon of honor, justice, and purity, he is revered by man and minotaur alike for confirming the first holy pacts between the two races.

Saint Goreath
Goreath, or Goreius, is said to have ruled as Emperor for more than four centuries in the First Era, before ceding the throne to his daughter Hestra and wandering into the wilderness. For many years thereafter, Goreath lived as a humble wanderer, atoning for the sins of his reign and making pilgrimage to many holy sites. Patron of travelers and storytellers.

Saint Hestra
Empress and popular Legion saint, patron of road-builders and maintainers. Red Hestra's bloodshed is sometimes upheld as an example of atrocities performed for a righteous cause. The interplay between savage blood-thirst and high civilization is her domain.

Saint Pelagius (the PIOUS)
Grandson of Tiber Septim, Pelagius I was blessed with great wisdom and piety. Pelagius' peaceful reign saw the confirmation and entrenchment of his grandsire's Imperial order, and the formal recognition of Tiber Imperator's ascension to the divinity of the Nine as Talos. Patron of conclaves and royal martyrs.

Saint Kintyra (the PATRON or the DANCER)
Kintyra I is revered for her divinely-inspired great public works, which brought joy and life to the people of her Empire. Patron of tattooists, actresses, and dancers in the Nibenese tradition.

Saint Uriel (the LAWMAKER or the GENTLE)
Uriel I, kindly and good-hearted, swept away centuries of arcane and contradictory Cyrod law, replacing it with the Lex Imperii, a divinely inspired code of justice that forms the basis of Imperial law and order to this day. Patron of barristers, magistrates, and jurists.

Saint Kintyra (the INFANT)
Short-lived Empress and martyr of the War of the Red Diamond, Kintyra II ruled briefly and justly in a time of immense challenge. Patron of untested rulers and prisoners.

Saint Cephorus
Cephorus I ably knit together the Empire after the ravages of the War of the Red Diamond, delivering justice and mercy in equal measure. He is revered by the Legions for his relentless commitment to order, his famed steadfastness, and his resolute piety. Patron of stewards, generals, and peace by force.
